senses.de: To look at something closely and carefully
senses.ex: The doctor examined the patient's eyes for any signs of infection.

Tips.title: Visual Attention
Tips.description: Used when you need to observe something with great care, like checking for tiny details.
Tips.example: Archaeologists examine artifacts for minute engravings.

Tips.title: Professional Assessment
Tips.description: Often involves a professional, like a doctor, checking for issues that require expertise.
Tips.example: The mechanic examined the engine to find the fault.

senses.de: To test or check the knowledge or ability of someone
senses.ex: The professor examined the students at the end of the semester.

Tips.title: Knowledge Test
Tips.description: Specific to the context of education or training, where someone's learning is evaluated.
Tips.example: At the interview, they examined her knowledge of French.

Tips.title: Academic Evaluation
Tips.description: Can imply a formal test setting or an informal assessment by an educator.
Tips.example: The instructor examined our grasp of the concept through a pop quiz.

senses.de: To analyze or investigate a topic or idea
senses.ex: The book examines the causes and effects of global warming.

Tips.title: Deep Analysis
Tips.description: In academic or intellectual contexts, it means to look into a topic deeply to understand all facets.
Tips.example: The study examines the long-term impacts of social media.

Tips.title: Critical Thinking
Tips.description: Encourages questioning and not just accepting information at face value in a given field.
Tips.example: Philosophers examine the nature of reality.

senses.ex: The lawyer examined the witness to uncover additional details.

Tips.title: Legal Questioning
Tips.description: Specific to law, where intense and often strategic questioning is used to discover facts.
Tips.example: The defense attorney examined the alibi's credibility.

Tips.title: Witness Credibility
Tips.description: Aims to assess the reliability of a witness or testimony in a legal context.
Tips.example: In court, the prosecutor thoroughly examined the witness's story.

Analyse.wordDefinition:
Analyse and examine both mean to study something closely, but there is a slight difference in their usage.

Analyse, on the other hand, typically means to break something down into its smaller parts in order to understand how it works or to evaluate it.

For example, a chemist may analyze a compound to understand its chemical structure and properties.

Examine means to observe while analyse means to observe and break down into smaller parts for a better understanding.

Check.wordDefinition:
Check means to quickly look over something or someone to make sure everything is okay, often with a specific purpose in mind.

For example, a teacher might check a student's homework to make sure they completed it, or a doctor might check a patient's heart rate to ensure it is normal.

Check is used to quickly verify that something is okay, while examine is used to investigate and learn more about something or someone.

Evaluate.wordDefinition:
Evaluate and examine are similar words, but they have different meanings.

To evaluate means to judge or assess the quality, value, or importance of something. It is when you think about something carefully, and then make a decision about it based on your thoughts.

For example, you might evaluate a new phone before deciding if it's worth buying.

In short, evaluating is about making a decision based on your thoughts, while examining is about trying to understand something better by studying it closely.

Explore.wordDefinition:
Explore typically means to travel or investigate an area or idea in order to discover or learn more information.

This is often used in situations where you are trying to uncover new knowledge or experiences, like exploring a new city or researching a new topic.

Examine is typically used when you need to carefully analyze or scrutinize something, while explore is typically used when you are seeking to learn more about something through investigation or discovery.

Inspect.wordDefinition:
It describes a thorough inspection or exploration of an object or subject. For example, a doctor may examine a patient to evaluate their symptoms and diagnose an illness.

Inspect means to examine something carefully in order to detect any faults or problems that need fixing.

It is typically used to describe a closer inspection or review of an object or property to ensure that it meets certain standards, regulations or requirements.

For example, a building inspector may inspect a house to ensure it meets safety regulations and building codes.

In summary, while both words involve looking at something closely, examine is used to explore or investigate something in detail, while inspect is used to carefully analyze or evaluate something to detect any faults or problems.

Probe.wordDefinition:
Both examine and probe mean to investigate or inspect, but they are used in slightly different contexts.

Probe, on the other hand, usually means to investigate more deeply or aggressively.

It can be used in a literal sense, like when a scientist probes deep into the earth to learn more about its composition, but it can also be used in a more figurative sense, like when a journalist probes a source for more information about a story.

Examine is best used when you want to carefully observe and learn about something, while probe is better suited for when you want to delve deeper and uncover more information, often through questioning or exploration.

Scrutinize.wordDefinition:
Examine means to look at something carefully and in detail, while scrutinize means to examine something very closely and critically.

Scrutinize is typically used in situations where a closer inspection is required or where a critical eye is needed. For example, scrutinizing a contract before signing it, scrutinizing a political candidate's policies before voting for them, or scrutinizing a scientific study before drawing conclusions from it.

Study.wordDefinition:
Study means to spend time looking at and understanding something in depth.

It is often used when you want to gain a comprehensive understanding of a topic or subject. For example, you might study a particular piece of literature to understand broader themes and motifs?.

Examine is more focused and narrow in scope, while study is more broad and comprehensive. Both words are applicable in a variety of situations, depending on what you are trying to achieve.

Survey.wordDefinition:
Survey means to get a general idea of something- to look at it briefly in order to understand its shape, size, or layout.

It can also describe a process of asking people questions to gather information- like a survey that asks people for their opinions or preferences.

quotes.Text: That's what we were exploring on 'Larry Sanders' - the human qualities that have brought us to where we are now in the world: the addiction to needing more and wanting more and talking more. We were examining the labels put on success - is it successful to be on TV every day, to be famous, to have a paycheck?
quotes.Title: American Comedian
quotes.Name: Garry Shandling

quotes.Text: There are always things to examine. What's great is not feeling that I have to refuse any of them. Maybe no good from a PR perspective, but from the point of view of everyday life, it keeps things interesting.
quotes.Title: English Composer
quotes.Name: Fred Frith

quotes.Text: If I were to ask you for example right now to go back with me and define those moments in your life that shaped you as a person and you began to reexamine them, something would happen.
quotes.Title: American Educator
quotes.Name: James Lipton

quotes.Text: Having kids sets a bomb off in your life. It really makes you examine who you are, what you believe in and what you want to be. And that is magical for creativity.
quotes.Title: English Musician
quotes.Name: Jamie Cullum

quotes.Text: I can trust my friends These people force me to examine myself, encourage me to grow.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Cher

quotes.Text: Cinema basically examines a personality first and the body afterward.
quotes.Title: British Director
quotes.Name: Peter Greenaway

quotes.Text: Literature plays a huge role in examining difficult real-life issues.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Angie Thomas

quotes.Text: Everybody knows if you don't have an examined life, you go mad.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Taylor Negron

quotes.Text: To know your ruling passion, examine your castles in the air.
quotes.Title: English Writer
quotes.Name: Richard Whately

quotes.Text: The unexamined life is not worth living.
quotes.Title: Greek Philosopher
quotes.Name: Socrates
